summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons Monthly Utility Usage Report for the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (NYM) for July 2019, detailing utility consumption and costs. It is significant as it covers the period when Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated at this facility prior to his death.

events.title: Monthly Utility Usage at MCC New York
events.description: The Federal Bureau of Prisons generated a utility usage report for the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (NYM) for the month of July 2019, showing consumption of fuel oil and electricity.

keyFacts: This document is a utility report for the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (NYM) for July 2019.
The report shows the facility consumed 143,205 KWH of electricity and 18 gallons of fuel oil during that month.
The total utility cost for July 2019 was $60,387.80.
The document's date range (July 1-31, 2019) coincides with Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration at this facility prior to his death in August 2019.
